alert.note: Alert for Umpqua Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 17 at 7:30PM PDT until August 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Abundant Lightning On Dry Fuels Expected Tonight into Thursday... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 620... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 11 PM PDT this evening. * Impacts: Lightning and high fire danger will likely result in new fire starts. Gusty thunderstorm winds could contribute to fire spread. Despite rainfall, initial attack resources could be overwhelmed and holdover fires are possible. * Affected area: - In southern Oregon, portions of Fire Zones 616, including the Umpqua National Forest from near Roseburg south to Glendale. * Thunderstorms: Isolated to scattered this evening with abundant lightning. Some storms may be dry. Winds will be gusty and erratic in and near thunderstorms. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
info.instruction: Abundant lightning on existing very dry fuels could cause numerous new fire ignitions. Gusty and erratic outflow winds could also create extreme fire growth potential.
